item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Get & Craft the Searching for Dreams Outfit
item.description:
Not all outfits in Infinity Nikki require players to spend their Bling or Diamonds to obtain them. Luckily for those who want to save their valuables, there are quite a few outfits you can find while completing quests in the overworld. These outfits will usually require you to craft them yourself, with many different materials being needed.

One of these outfits, Searching for Dreams , can be obtained through completing a variety of different Styling Challenges, and you will also need a few different materials to craft all pieces. If you want to make this outfit for your own collection, here's what you need to do.

How to Get the Searching for Dreams Outfit in Infinity Nikki

If you want to get started on obtaining the sketches for Searching for Dreams, you will need to take a visit to the region of Stoneville. This area can be found on the western side of the map. Specifically, you are going to have to complete the Faction Styling Challenges in the area, starting with Raging Rocks (Matteo, Frosty, Jayden, and Lewen Dewey). You can find all the Factions in the Faction section of your Pear Pal.

Below, you can find all the pieces in the Searching for Dreams outfit and what you will need to do to obtain them.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Fan Shows Off Hex Maniac Cosplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon Legends Z-A teaser introduces updated Hex Maniac design.
  • Fans excited for Hex Maniac's return due to occult & supernatural themes.
  • Cosplayer recreates Hex Maniac's new look, praised for attention to detail.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A has just barely given expectant fans their first glimpse of the Hex Maniac, but that hasn't stopped one cosplayer from seizing the new opportunity. Pokemon Legends: Z-A fans are sharing their praise for the quick cosplay, and their excitement over the return of the Hex Maniac.

The Hex Maniac in Pokemon has always been something of a mystery. The game franchise has included the occult and supernatural themes since the very first title, while the Hex Maniac made her first official appearance in Gen 3. Since then, most of the games have included a Hex Maniac trainer, or in some cases, an apparition ghost girl that spontaneously appears in Pokemon games.

Pokemon cosplayer sadgirlcitycos has now shared their rendition of the Hex Maniac as they appear in Pokemon Legends: Z-A . Hex Maniac's outfit and appearance have changed somewhat since her last incarnation, with her wearing a shorter layered black dress, a purple ribbon, corset belt, and purple earrings. The cosplayer does a great job of replicating this new look, sans the purple earrings, even going so far as to use makeup to emulate the tired downturned eye look that Hex Maniac has in her first reveal. Fans have been quick to share their support for the cosplayer's effort, complimenting the overall look, makeup, and recommending that the cosplayer add the purple earrings to fully polish the design.

Hex Maniac's Return Has Been Long-Awaited

Pokemon fans have counted on seeing a Hex Maniac appear in nearly every game ever since she's become a regular part of the series. However, Hex Maniac has a particular tie to Lumiose City, where Pokemon Legends: Z-A is set. In Pokemon X and Y , which was also set there, players were particularly spooked by a Hex Maniac - or a ghost that looks just like her - suddenly appearing behind the player, declaring that they're not the one, and then gliding out of view. No explanation for the character's random appearance was ever shared. While there's a good chance that the games will continue with the randomness and secretive nature of this encounter, players are particularly hopeful that the Hex Maniac's inclusion in the Pokemon Legends: Z-A teaser will mean a follow-up to that odd moment.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A still has a lot to show fans, and a bit to prove following the messy launch of Pokemon Scarlet and Violet . With a late 2025 release window, players may still have to wait a while before they learn more about what the game has in store for them.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Tips For Co-Op
item.description:
Summary

  • Study target monster weaknesses to improve hunt success.
  • Restock on important items to ensure preparedness for any danger.
  • Communicate with teammates for better teamwork and hunt completion.

The developers at Capcom have captured lightning in a bottle once again with the most recent installment in the Monster Hunter franchise, Monster Hunter Wilds . Fans have been greatly anticipating the release and can finally jump into the massive frontier of Monster Hunter Wilds with its slew of upgraded systems, new mechanics, and uniquely crafted campaign. On top of all its new features and gameplay, Monster Hunter Wilds also brings a horde of new and returning monsters for players to hunt down.

Massive behemoths that won't hesitate to put a few hunters on the menu have come back with more ferocity than ever before. In order to take on these vicious creatures, Hunters will need to team up with friends to make sure the job gets done. However, for new players, and even returning players, there are some things to consider before jumping into multiplayer. Here are some tips for co-op in Monster Hunter Wilds .

6 Study The Target Monster Closely

Monsters Have Weaknesses That Can Be Taken Advantage Of

Monster Hunter Wilds has an extensive list of monsters for players to hunt. While still trying to make do with starting gear, Hunters can make it through Lower Rank. However, once they achieve High Rank, it is paramount that players begin to study the targets of their missions. Elemental weakness and resistance are critical mechanics that can turn a challenging hunt into a cakewalk. Knowing the ins and outs of a monster before jumping into a co-op hunt can be an incredible help and lift the team up.

5 Restock On Important Items

Having the Right Item At The Right Time Can Be Vital

Hunts can be grueling experiences, especially for new players starting out with few resources. Thankfully, Monster Hunter Wilds provides a wide array of items that can make a difference in a hunt, and most of them are easy to obtain.

Most items in Monster Hunter Wilds can be gathered, or can be crafted from gathered materials. Items like positions, Bombs, Cool Drink, and Antidotes are all useful and can improve survivability during a hunt. Making sure that reserves are stacked and never jumping into a hunt with empty pockets will ensure that the team is prepared for any type of danger.

4 Communicate With Teammates

Coordination During A Hunt Raises Completion Chance Exponentially

As the saying goes, teamwork makes the dream work. In Monster Hunter Wilds, hunting as a team makes everything more manageable as long as each hunter does their part. Jumping into a random hunt can be done with little issue depending on the monster. Utilizing all the tools at a hunter's disposal makes a big difference, and one of those tools is vice chat.

As Hunters rise through the ranks and take on the game's most brutal content, players will need to communicate with each other to ensure a hunt goes by without issue. In a hectic environment with an unpredictable monster, players will want to be able to relay information to each other quickly, and the best way to do so is with clear communication.

3 Build Appropriately For The Target Hunt

Weapons And Armor Can Give Hunters Advantages

Monster Hunter Wilds comes with a slew of new armor and weapons for players to craft, modify, and enjoy. With so many options, it's critical that players go out and test the waters to find out what works best for them.

Additionally, it's crucial that players find the right weapons for the job as they reach High Rank. Weapon types, damage types, and elemental types are all important factors when jumping into a hunt. Secondly, having the right armor with the right buffs and resistance can be a significant help against getting carted.

2 Don't Be Toxic

Always Treat Fellow Hunters With Respect

Monster Hunter Wilds is a challenging game that takes focus and dedication. Hunts can go on for quite some time, and monsters can easily frustrate players. High tensions can create an easy avenue to negativity, but it's essential for all players to get along and to treat each other with respect.

Since there are thousands of players in the game of varying skill levels, players should always strive to be a beacon of support to other players who may be struggling to create a welcoming community in the game. Griefing, harassment, and taunting should never be an option while playing cooperatively, and players should make an active effort to discourage this if they see it happening.

1 Try Not To Hit Teammates

Large Weapons Can Affect Fellow Players

One of the most minor factors, but one of the most persistent in Monster Hunter Wilds , is the ability to affect teammates with weapon attacks.

Weapon combos are a core mechanic in Monster Hunter Wilds . However, due to the size of some of the weapons in the game, conflict can be a prevalent side effect when in proximity to other players. The Lance, Long Sword, Great Sword, and many weapons like these can nudge or shove a teammate. While tunnel vision is a separate problem, players should try to ensure they are clear of other players' weapons and vice versa, to reduce the risk of accidentally catching a friend in the crossfire.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: The Best Katanas (& Where To Find Them)
item.description:
Cyberpunk 2077 has plenty of incredible melee weapons, but those looking to hack and slash their way through the many gangs of Night City and even take on MaxTac themselves might want to look for the best Iconic Katanas in Cyberpunk 2077 . With 9 Iconic Katanas in Cyberpunk 2077 , its essential to know where to find them and which of them will offer players the best time.

For the chooms that want to unlock their inner samurai and impress Johnny Silverhand, the best Katanas will be essential for their builds, offering players high-risk and high-reward playstyles that will see them shred the competition with a loyal blade, aided by the special effects that come with Iconic weapons.

Updated on March 3, 2025, by Jake Fillery: It's vitally important to run through Night City with the best weapons that Cyberpunk 2077 has to offer, and within that heavy arsenal, is an assortment of blades, from katanas to knives that will really solidify themselves as some of the strongest and coolest weapons. Listed below, is every Iconic katana in Cyberpunk 2077, and just how to get them all for V's stash.

13

12 Volkodav

The Wolf Crusher That Burns as it Slashes

Attack Speed

1.5

Damage Per Hit

45

Stamina Cost

12

Effects

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +33% Burn Chance

Iconic Modifier

Grants a chance to inflict a unique burn on the enemy. Shooting an enemy affected by this burn always deals Crit Damage. The more enemies simultaneously affected by this burn, the more Crit Damage you deal but at the cost of accuracy.

  • How to Get Volkodav: Found inside the Police Station in the Gig, Waiting for Dodger (Phantom Liberty)

Volkodav has an interesting modifier to its Iconic status, as it synergizes with the use of weapons by allowing almost 1 in every 3 hits to set an enemy on fire, and while on fire, that enemy is weaker to headshots. However, the idea of a machete in Cyberpunk 2077 that is only used to de-buff targets before shooting them in the head makes it a lacking weapon when other options permit pure melee-focused fury.

11 Black Unicorn

A Hard-Hitting Katana Where Stamina Means Nothing

Attack Speed

2.1

Damage Per Hit

117

Stamina Cost

  • +25% Armor Penetration
  • +20% Bleeding Chance

Iconic Modifier

Attack speed is not affected by Stamina.

  • How to Get Black Unicorn: Own Cyberpunk 2077 on GOG Galaxy, or link your Cyberpunk 2077 account to GOG.

The Black Unicorn may share a reference with The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , but the similarity ends there. It's a sharp katana that might be useful at the start of the game due to how accessible it is within V's Stash, but it's a katana that doesn't see much use when compared to alternatives. Players can continue to swing the sword when their Stamina runs dry, but swinging wildly and without precision isn't the mark of a true samurai.

10 Tsumetogi

A Katana That Deals Electrified Attacks

Attack Speed

2.1

Damage Per Hit

8.0

Slightly increases Electrical damage and grants a small chance to apply Shock to the enemy. Non-standard attacks deal more damage.

  • How to Get Tsumetogi: Found in a display stand in the Pisces mission, or looted from Hiromi Sato.

Tsumetogi is a visually stunning Iconic Katana, but outside of its looks, it doesn't serve players all that well. It's a katana that provides bonus Electrical damage and a minuscule chance to apply Shock to enemies, and that's pretty much it. While players can see 5% more damage from stronger attacks like blocks, sprinting, and jumping, there's just not enough of a bonus to warrant using this warrior's blade.

When Optical Camo is active, hitting an enemy causes Bleeding. bleeding caused in this way lasts longer than usual.

  • How to Get Cocktail Stick: Inside the dressing room within Clouds during the Automatic Love mission.

The cocktail stick isn't the most flattering of weapons visually, and there's something a tad crude and lewd about its design within Clouds. However, despite its visual style, it's a weapon that does a great job of impaling targets who are unaware. Cocktail Stick provides a 16-second Bleed effect for enemies attacked while V is using Optical Camo, and this ability will also disable the affected enemies' abilities to double-jump, dash, and dodge, making for a weapon viable for shutting down certain types of enemies, but also one that's a tad too situational.

  • How to Get Errata: Found within Electric Corporation's Power Plant forge within the Disasterpiece mission.

Errata easily has one of the best visual styles of any katana in Cyberpunk 2077 thanks to its glowing blade, but it's also one with a rather lacking modifier. Those who use Errata might want to watch the world burn, as it provides aggression like no other by allowing players to leap toward enemies and risk burning them with a 30% chance for every strike. Those affected by Burning will get guaranteed Crit Damage from every Errata strike. It's aggressive and fiery, but not the best.

Allows you to leap toward distant enemies. When Satori is sheathed, hold Left-Click/R2 to perform a Quickdraw Attack that is guaranteed to inflict Bleeding. If the enemy is already affected by Bleeding from Nehan, Satori will cause hemorrhaging instead.

  • How to Get Satori: Found within Saburo Arasaka's AV on the rooftop during The Heist.

One of the first katanas players can find in Cyberpunk 2077 is a rather important one, as it's the blade of Saburo Arasaka. Despite the stature and power of this man, his katana isn't all that special, and players will need to pair it with the Nehan knife for further effects, as using Nehan to provide Bleeding and then using Satori as a main method of attack will provide hemorrhaging, which siphons health from enemies into V. Geralt's iconic sword from The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt goes Cyberpunk with its addition to Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty . This katana has a few great sets of modifiers thanks to its ability to deal more damage on the plethora of bosses within Night City and Dogtown. It's a katana that also sees complementary styles from killing enemies, as each kill bolsters time where every hit is a Critical Hit for extended damage, but it's a tad high-risk and high-reward due to the high-damage output, but lacks invested healing.

Jinch-maru provides a classic feel to a razor-sharp katana, and its modifier bolsters that feeling by gifting players the opportunity to strike and kill those most foul. On top of having increased damage against Elite enemies, Jinch-maru also favors a flurry of attacks in a combo, for the last hit provides Crit damage. To those who want further Crit damage, Optical Camo will be their ally, as it provides both stealth and Crit damage on each hit while it's active.

The only sword in Cyberpunk 2077 that allows for mod use makes the Cut-o-Matic X-MOD2 worth trying out, especially when it is so exciting in violence. This is a weapon that can't be used for stealth brawls, as the weapon is always loud like a whirring chainsaw so that everyone knows what comes next. Yet, that's what makes it so fun, since it's a weapon used to clear out civilians and make enemies aware of the cuts that they are about to experience.

It's a competent weapon with a fast swing speed and a low stamina cost, and the fact that almost 1 in every 5 hits will cause bleeding, is even better. Byakko is easily one of the best Katanas in Cyberpunk 2077 thanks to its unique modifier that allows players to set themselves up as the Grim Reaper. With just one kill, players will see an increase to attack speed by over 17.5%, allowing them to continuously hack and slash at their enemies with unrelenting fury. It's a katana well worth the grind of Wakako's missions, and just after one kill, players can easily see an improvement in their fighting style due to their fast attack speed.

For players who need something more precise for their builds, Scalpel might be the tool they are looking for. This is a katana that really only works well with Sandevistan, but that's a Cyberware that everyone should have if they want to use melee weapons due to how it slows time to the point where it practically stops for everyone but V. With Sandevistan active, players are able to attack enemies with unrelenting precision, with each attack being a near-instant Crit Chance and Bleeding Chance to really cut everyone up before they can even register what's going on.

item.title: World of Warcraft Classic Season of Discovery Isn't Ending With Phase 7
item.description:
Summary

  • WoW Classic's Season of Discovery won't end in Phase 7, according to senior game producer Josh Aggrend Greenfield.
  • Developers want to avoid setting a definite end date to allow players to enjoy content for months or even years.
  • Season of Discovery will not have a hard end date, and servers will remain available as long as WoW Classic exists.

World of Warcraft Classic recently revealed that Season of Discovery is not ending in Phase 7 and may not even end in Phase 8. While there will come a time when World of Warcraft stops actively developing Season of Discovery, the experimental Classic servers will still remain available for players to enjoy in some form indefinitely.

During the Warcraft Direct presentation in November 2024, World of Warcraft Classic Season of Discovery revealed Phase 7 of the experimental Realms would be its final one. This World of Warcraft Classic Season of Discovery update was released in January 2025, adding exciting content like the Karazhan Crypts dungeon and Naxxramas raid to the game. However, little communication about what is next for Season of Discovery has been shared since then, leaving the future of the servers in question.

This led World of Warcraft Classic content creator Hammerdance to share a YouTube video called A Message To The WoW Classic Dev Team | Season of Discovery. On behalf of the WoW community, Hammerdance asked the developers for clarification on what was going on with Season of Discovery and World of Warcraft responded directly. In the videos comments section, WoW Classic senior game producer Josh Aggrend Greenfield confirmed that the team was all-in on a really great, really robust phase 8, despite previous claims that Phase 7 would be the end of World of Warcraft Classic Season of Discovery. The update will feature the Scarlet Enclave raid teased during the Warcraft Direct, though he could not share too many other details on what else would be in it.

The Future of WoW Classic Season of Discovery

That said, Season of Discovery may not even end there. The reality is, we think there are many many many months of content in SoD left, he said, and trying to put a pin on a definite end date really just harms the experience of people that could still have months if not years of fun with the content that already exists and is coming. Greenfield does not want to mark Phase 8 as the endpoint, as that could discourage a lot of fans from jumping into Season of Discovery because of a preconception that it would be too late to do so.

The walking back of Phase 7 being its final one is an example of why WoW Classic doesnt want to reveal too much about the future of Season of Discovery ahead of time. By claiming Phase 7 would be the final phase of Season of Discovery during the Warcraft Direct, the development team put itself in a tricky spot, and set expectations for players that they now must unmake. Giving too much info too early can be harmful because of the TLDR nature of communications and info sharing these days, Greenfield admitted, which led to some fans being afraid to invest in Season of Discovery for fear that it could end in a matter of months.

The reality is, we think there are many many many months of content in SoD left, and trying to put a pin on a definite end date really just harms the experience of people that could still have months if not years of fun with the content that already exists and is coming.

In actuality, Greenfield confirmed Season of Discovery will never truly end for as long as WoW Classic is around. SoD will end in the sense that we will stop actively developing new large amounts of new content, he said, but it won't be a hard it ends today date and we have no intention of closing SoD servers. Though other seasonal experiments or possibly even Classic+ may eventually happen, Greenfield assured players that Season of Discovery realms will persist in some form, emphasizing that its never too late to start and the more eyes and feedback and lessons we get from what we put out in SoD, the better the next thing we work on will be.
